channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nvidia is set to resume sales of its AI chips to China. Here’s who’s on the ‘whitelist’ of buyers
item.description: Chinese firms are scrambling to buy Nvidia’s H20 artificial intelligence chips , two sources told Reuters, as the company said it planned to resume sa...

item.title: The forecast for the U.S. economy looks cloudy as inflation rises: ‘It would be wise for the Fed to remain on the sidelines’
item.description: The effects of President Donald Trump’s tariff policy are beginning to worm their way through the economy.

item.title: Starbucks Just Made a Big Announcement About Remote Work. 2 Very Important Words Were Missing
item.description: Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol’s words will hold a lot more weight if he can show Starbucks employees he’s willing to do what he’s asking them to do.

item.title: Why Nextdoor Just Relaunched Its App Under the Original Co-Founder
item.description: Nirav Tolia is back at the company he co-founded and says the app’s redesign will make it more useful and timely.

item.title: Stamps just got more expensive. Here’s what it will cost you to mail a letter now
item.description: Yep, postcards will cost more too.

item.title: My Employees Don’t Acknowledge the Company’s Appreciation Initiatives
item.description: Is it too much to expect a thank-you?

item.title: Apple is pre-bunkering against China with its $500 million deal to buy American rare-earth magnets
item.description: Apple’s deal with MP Materials is more than just a supply-chain strategy. It's a geopolitical insurance policy.

item.title: ‘Good Trouble Lives On’: July 17 to see protests against Trump in all 50 states over voting rights, racial justice. Here’s what to know
item.description: Organizers of the recent “ No Kings Day ” and “ Hands Off ” pro-democracy protests against the Trump administration have planned another nationwide da...

item.title: Google’s head of Android once cold-emailed the $2 trillion tech giant’s cofounder Sergey Brin for graduate school advice—he got a job offer instead
item.description: Early in his career, Sameer Samat’s cofounders wanted to ditch their startup for college. A 3 a.m. email to Google’s cofounder Sergey Brin changed the...

item.title: Amazon Web Services CEO Matt Garman talks about why the company lagged rivals in AI—until now
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: This glowing, otherworldly dress is made from millions of living organisms

item.title: Elon Musk’s chatbot Grok searches for his views before answering questions

item.title: Waymo Just Crossed 100 Million Miles of Driverless Rides. Meanwhile, Tesla Has Started Small
item.description: Waymo is picking up speed as Tesla eyes expanding its own more limited robotaxi services.

item.title: The 10 U.S. States With the Highest Layoff Rates
item.description: A new analysis of government data shows the places where layoffs have hit hardest in relation to the size of a state’s total workforce.
